admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia
trustfund:
TF038687-TURKEY:  BASIC EDUCATION APL I
            AND II,TF040181-TURKEY - BASIC EDUCATION APL I PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Basic Education Project will
            support implementation of the Government basic education
            program, over the years 2002-2005, and builds on the actions
            supported under the first operation, through the development
            of preschool education, as an integral part of basic
            education and educational special needs. The project
            components will: 1) extend basic education coverage, by
            supporting continued rehabilitation, and extension of rural,
            and low-income areas' schools, through the construction
            of new preschool classrooms in existing basic education
            schools, as well as the renovation, and extension of schools
            for children with special needs; 2) improve basic education
            quality, through continued investments for schools'
            equipment, which includes computer facilities. The component
            will further initiate expansion of formal preschool
            education, and education for children with special needs,
            and, additionally, non-formal education, and early childhood
            development will be supported, targeted specifically for
            deprived households; 3) support in-service training in
            information, and communications technology (ICT) to teachers
            to improve basic computer skills, and assist in utilizing
            ICT to improve instruction, to inspectors to prod
            pedagogical ICT support to schools, and to assist computer
            instructors for the full utilization of ICT classroom
            potential. As the previous components, teachers of children
            with special needs, early childhood parents, and preschool
            teachers, will benefit from specifically designed training
            courses; 4) finance consulting services in the areas of
            project management, procurement aspects, financial
            management, including construction issues, equipment supply,
            and training needs; and, 5) support studies to assess
            program outcomes, particularly supporting semi-annual reviews.
